The word "now" is an adverb that can be used to indicate the present time or a sense of immediacy. In terms of punctuation, the word "now" does not require any specific punctuation when used in a sentence. It can be used as a standalone word or as part of a sentence, depending on the context.

For example, "I'm busy now" is a complete sentence that uses "now" to indicate the present time. In this case, there is no need for any additional punctuation because the sentence is grammatically complete. However, if "now" is used in a context where it is emphasizing a point, it may be followed by an exclamation mark to convey a sense of urgency or importance. For instance, "I need to speak with you now!" emphasizes the urgency of the situation and may warrant the use of an exclamation mark.
